synopsis: In this engaging episode of Pineapple Blunt Rotation, hosts Devam and Ahir, joined by guest Garrett, dive deep into the complex relationship between body image and the gym. They share personal stories, discuss the impact of societal standards on self-perception, and explore the importance of enjoying fitness as a positive outlet rather than a measure of self-worth.
quotes: The horror is persist, but so do we.
You have to get into the thick of it in order to get out again.
If you're going to the gym to improve the way you look, you should also be going to the gym because it's something you can enjoy.
Comparison is the thief of joy.
You shouldn't look at a fitness influencer and say, 'I should be looking like that.'
Your body is not the only thing that defines you.
Don't be afraid to talk to people; having a friend in the gym is only a positive thing.
Drink water; if you didn't take anything else away from this episode, drink more water.
If you hate going to the gym, it's time for a change.
